Great experience!! My dad brought me here to show me his old stomping grounds from when he was getting his masters at ASU and I was thoroughly impressed. The food was great, the drink selection was awesome for beer or ale lovers, and the service rocked! I really enjoyed the fish pond and outdoor seating, it's great for intimate gatherings or just a night out with friends!!

Okay for starters I'd give this place 0 stars if that was an option. This was hands down the worst Los Favs I've ever been to and let me explain why... 
So for starters I went to get a drink and wait for my ride which took about 20 minutes and I wanted to pass time so I went to claw machine. I got there and a bear was dangling off the claw so I was happy and put a dollar into the machine for two turns and played. It didn't fall after repeatedly hitting the side and I never got my second try. I went and asked for 50 cents for the second try and one of the workers rudely told me they don't have the keys for the machine, I understood because they never saw me put a dollar in and I get it so I asked for change for a 20 and she told she only had a dollar in her drawer and pulled the last dollar to show me. Right after I asked for the change she took the tip money from my view and went to the back and came back with a empty jar assuming I was going to steal the money! I sat down and kept drinking my lemonade still waiting for my ride and two customers after that whole tip money incident had a 20 and she gave him change from the second drawer. This highly upset me, and I felt like I wasn't treated equally. After this she threatened me that if I don't order food that she will call the cops on me. So I told her she can call, for the fact that I did nothing wrong. A few minutes later she changes her story and said she's calling her manager instead! So my ride came and told me to get them a bean burrito so I go up the counter because not only did I want to order I wanted to get this rude and unfair workers name. Before I can even walk up to the counter to order she took off her name tag and put it in her pocket! She refused to give me her or her managers name. If she didn't want me knowing her name, she shouldn't treat customers so disrespectfully. While I was at the counter trying to order she didn't want to take me as a serious paying customers and insisted that the customers in back of me go in front of me! Not the way the business should be runned. Stay away from this Los Favs! 

I'm not trying to be the bad guy here, I just don't think this is how a business should handle their customers.

I went to Lucile's last night with my fianc and our kids. I was really craving GOOD BBQ..that being said..I shouldn't have came here. Tough Tri-tip..over cooked ribs. Cheese grits tasted like powder cheese. My daughter hated the alfredo. On the bright side..my girl liked her drink. I'm gonna pass in the future.

I wasn't sure if I had a couple dvds that I was about to buy. I asked if they could check my history to see if I bought them before they said they couldn't. I left my phone in the car so I couldn't check. They told me you've got 7 days to return them it's ok. So I bought them. I went out to my car and checked my phone sure enough I already had them. So I walked right back in the store and they had to ask the manager for the return. Once the dude came back he's all we can return them only for store credit. If that was the case you guys need to let people know who are buying items once they buy them you can only return them for store credit. Which doesn't make sense but I guess that's there policy. If I was told that up front I wouldn't of bought them cause I wasn't sure if I had them. So now I'm left with a bad taste in mouth over for 20 dollars. You guys need to start letting people know they will only get store credit for returns
The waitress was great but the food was not. My chicken was rubbery and poorly seasoned.  I just ate a few bites of the chicken which I ended up giving the leftover chicken to my parent's dog.
Nice selection of beer on tap and try the Mac & Cheese--its sinful.

I can't get enough of Ted's!  I'm in Tempe once or twice a week (at least) and I'll usually have lunch at Ted's.  They easily have the best hot dogs in the east valley.  There's always a line for lunch (depending on when you go--there have been times there wasn't a line when I walked in) and it can run the length of the building and out the side door.  Whatever your wait, it'll be worth it.  I stick with the all-beer hot dog or the foot- long dog with mustard, chili and cheese, a side of fries and a large drink and they get $9 from me--and I happily hand it over.

Beautiful spot with awesome food! The place is decorated wonderfully and everything on the menu looks wonderful. I had the half salad half pasta combo. I wanted the asparagus soup but they were out. The servers were very nice but slow and forgetful. They left the door open on a cold, rainy night so we were freezing but we enjoyed our food so much!
Out of all the stadiums in Arizona, this is clearly the worst. Poorly designed and overselling games

Being an avid music fan, I've been to many venues in the Phoenix area over the years. Once hailed as the Red River Opry - a venue that provided Branson like country music fair - it exchanged ownership and brought in a plethora of national and local music acts. 

A patron for some years, I've seen several concerts at this venue, and aside from the occasional out of hand drunk or the one off fights that break out, I thoroughly enjoy myself every time I walk through their doors.

Up close and personal doesn't begin to describe the vibe of The Marquee Theater. There is a never a bad place to watch the show, and if you keep your eyes peeled, you may encounter one of your favorite musicians milling about watching the other acts or at the merchandise booth signing autographs and taking pictures.

The location in Phoenix really surprised me. I went in to get just a bed frame and headboard and they hooked it up! No joke. These people treated me like I was one of them, they listened to my needs and the capitalized by giving me more than I could've hoped for for the same price of the single item. I've been shopping for furniture for a while but he prices everywhere scared me. Cesar made me feel comfortable by giving me the best deal! Plus they threw in free things like a mattress cover to avoid staining my new bed and they even threw in a free box spring just because! That wasn't part of the deal and did it nonetheless. The big stores say they have the best prices but these guys factually and literally do have the best prices. I challenge everyone to compare the prices and I'm confident that they won't be able to beat it. I rate hem five stars because besides them giving such a great deal they even shipped it over to my house the same day and even saved me the hassle of assembling it myself. If I could use only a few words to describe them I would say, professional, courteous and very knowledgeable.

So I've been looking for a good place to smoke hookah since I moved out here from California. I've tried other places but always left disappointed.  My friends and I were hesitant to try this place because it wasn't on Yelp.  Shortly after we realized that was a damn shame because these guys are awesome. 

Their hookah is amazing. No burning and always hits strong. The environment is dark but not too dark.  They have an awesome selection with 45 flavors. There was music playing at a perfect level. They offered world class customer service. From my experience at hookah lounges, that is a rarity. Its conveniently located right across from the Tempe Improv and right behind Devil's Advocate Bar. They also stay open late so if you get kicked from Devil's Advocate at 2am roll on over and smoke some fine shisha.

This review is solely based on the food served in the quaint little back kitchen area. First off, props to all the female workers in the back kitchen putting out great food. We had the pani puri, samosa chaat, dhokla, methi paratha, and choley bhatura. The pani puri was super flavorful, though the pani was really spicy. If you like spice, you'll love it! The samosa chaat was also really well made and quite well balanced in terms of flavor. I didn't personally get to taste the dhokla, but my friend seemed to love it. Choley bhatura came with two giant bhaturas and a good portion of choley on the side. It was very filling in terms of portion and tasted pretty good overall. Now, you should know that they make their methi parathas by hand. They were just so tasty! The methi paratha came with a side of pickle and yogurt.

I have to admit I was super confused about how to order when I first walked in. You essentially go pick up a blue slip located next to the water and mark what you would like to order. Then you give the slip to someone in the back kitchen and they will bring your food out. After you're done eating, you go and pay at the front. The women in the back kitchen were very nice and really accommodating about our orders. I can't really comment on the owner at the front because he just rang our bill up without ever saying anything.

Overall, this place has GREAT food and is definitely the place to go for Indian dishes.

Desert Botanical Garden is a great place to go alone, with a significant other, or family/friends. The entrance fee for adults is $25 and there is a senior discount and a lower price for youth. 

I dropped by with my family on a Friday afternoon around 4:00 pm in an attempt to avoid the heat. We moved through all the different areas of the botanical garden in about 2.5-3 hours and really enjoyed looking at the different plant varieties, sculptures, installations, and interactive set ups. It's a very beautiful garden which affords a few city and mountain views depending on which part of the garden you are in. 

There are restrooms dispersed throughout the garden so you don't have to worry about using the bathroom as soon as you come in. There are also water fountains scattered throughout so you have a water source even if you forget your water bottle or something of that sort. There are also benches and chairs in various areas so you can sit down if you are tired or if you want to just sit in the shade, relax, and enjoy the view.

I happened upon Doc's when I searching for a post-lunch dessert fix. It's easy to miss this place because it is nestled within a complex so definitely keep your eyes open if you're driving there. This place legitimately had the best chocolate gelato I have ever tasted in my entire life. It was just perfectly sweet without being overwhelming and I actually didn't tire of the flavor as I kept eating. My friends really enjoyed the mango sorbet and the sweet cream & passion fruit flavors as well. It is somewhat pricey, $3.75 for the small cup and $5.00 for the large cup, but I really feel like my purchase was worth every cent. In terms of seating, there are a few tables inside and a few outside as well. Service was very friendly and helpful. Overall, a great dessert adventure. I would highly recommend that you check out this place if you are in need of some great gelato.

I read previous reviews & thought this would be a great little hole in the wall. Ugh. Ordered a hamburger for grandson & he's 4 & will eat anything but not this burger. Hope we don't get food poisoning. The salsa was not only waay too hot but the flavor sucked. The chips were disgusting & beans nasty. Never never again. Barf

If I could give them zero stars, I most certainly would.  In 2003 I purchased a water softener from Puretec which was acquired by Aqua Science.  The water softener came with a "lifetime" warranty.   Some years ago the unit broke down and while Aqua Science begrudgingly came out and did the work, they made sure that they needed to redo some of the plumbing so they charged me a few hundred dollars.
Fast forward to 2016 - the unit breaks down again.  They look up my account and now insist that they will not honor the warranty at all.

When I first came to Lydian Dental I was terrified of the dentist. I've been a patient of Dr Connell's for 2 years now and always love my dental cleanings with April. They always give the best care with a personal touch. I actually look forward to going to the dentist. My dental health is forever grateful!!!

I bought a voucher on Deal Chicken and called numerous times to schedule. The frst time I had to leave a message no answer they called back and said they would have the girl in the office call to schedule. She called back a couple of days later and couldn't schedule me at that time for the day I needed. I have a very tight schedule and Tuesday is the only day I am home all day. She said would get back to me which she never called. I called back and finally got it scheduled for Tuesday before Thanksgiving they were a no call no show I called the next day and he said they had a hose break. He said he would come out on Friday and give us the vip treatment because of the mix up. I said  that I would have to have my daughter come over since I would be out of town.  Again no call no show. I called today Tuesday and to find out what happened and he said their truck broke down and was in the shop. Still doesn't explain why he didn't call to say they couldn't make it. Thats is just common courtesy and good business practice. I told them I was going to ask for a refund from Deal Chicken he got very angry and accused me of yelling at him and hung up on me. I got on the phone and called Deal Chicken and they refunded the money. As I was on the phone with them  David called and left me a very snotty message saying he spoke with his business partner they would give me a month free and they were trying to work with me as it had only been a week and they had equipment break down and I was trying to ruin their reputation with Deal Chicken they were going to tell Deal Chicken what they offered me and I wasn't working with them. I wasn't looking for something extra I just wanted what I paid for. The thing is all it would have taken was a PHONE CALL to say they were having equipment problems. I shouldn't be the one that had to call them both times to find out they were having problems. He had two opportunities to call and didn't do it either time. We own a business I understand things happen but you don't leave customers hanging a phone call goes a long ways. I wouldn't have ever written this review had David not called and left me that message. That is bad business

Good sushi not great. Be ready to break the bank a little, especially if you get an alcoholic drink. For the "good sushi" you get I don't think it is worth the bill. With the location right on Mill Ave, I guess you'd be hard pressed to go somewhere else if you're really craving sushi.

Although this place isn't how it used to be, it is still one of my favorite pizza places in the valley. You can sort of tell when a place is getting commercialized and losing its touch and that's what I feel is going on here slowly but surely. I'm just going to ride the Venezia's wave until it completely fades. Still pretty good pizza....for now at least.

Best Pizza in ASU! The service is great and the pizza is very flavorful. Me being from NYC, I'm very very picky on the kind of pizza I eat. I had the 14 inch Buffalo Chicken Pizza and it was so delicious! If you're on Mill Ave and you're craving pizza, come here!

The sushi was OKAY. Not bad and not great. I was trying to see what the hype is all about and unfortunately I was left wondering if I had wasted my money. Our server wasn't really attentive and personable. It seemed like she was rushing us out for her tip. The only reason why I gave this place 3 stars was the complementary edamame. Who does that?! The fact that they gave complementary edamame really saved this place from getting 1 star. Anyways overall I don't think I would come back here based on the bad service and the "basic" sushi everyone is hyping up.
Everything I've gotten from here has been clutch. Enchiladas and tacos are really good.The food is reasonably priced too.  If you are ever on Mill and want some Mexican food, gotta come here.

First time eating from here and I gotta say the food is delicious. My favorite is the Southwestern Club on wheat bread! It's moderately priced and you can call ahead to have your food ready. 

The guys working there are really down to earth and made my sandwich exactly how I like it. Most deli places are shy on the meat but this place will satisfy your hunger without resorting to fast food. It just seemed like everyone eating here didn't seem disappointed. You know the place is good when the local police are swarming here on lunch breaks to get a sandwich or some soup.My job isn't too far from here so I have a feeling this will be the place to go every so often. Kudos Dillys on your excellent food and service.

Preferred has a great teaching Respiratory Therpist to explain everything you need to do in exquisite detail. They also stock great equipment and supplies and are expert at negotiating with insurance companies for.you.

I seriously only come here for the drinks and they even manage to mess that up too sometimes. I never get wings from here anymore considering they just slap on the sauce. It seems their money maker is the sporting events where they'll get a large turn out. Even so, don't waste your time. Their drinks are mediocre. Look elsewhere

Beautiful and stylish store. It was a pleasure looking at different ideas and styles. Jo Ann Ronaldo - a showroom manager- blown us away with her extensive knowledge of  everything concerning tiling. We were sent home with all our questions answered and with several samples and brochures to help us visualize how our future bathroom is going to look like. It was a pleasurable and very educational experience.
Very good! It is a family run business. The food was tasty and fresh. It was prepared super fast. And the owners are very friendly and pleasant. We went there two days in a row and will go again!

Ate there for the first time today. My sister-in-law took me it was her 3rd time this week! I was not let down. The service was prompt and friendly and the food was delicious! I will go back as soon as I get the chance!

They have 2 rides, a 20 minute 4D movie, places to build legos, ramps to race lego cars, a play area (kids need socks), and a lego city for viewing, and a cafe. 

 We took our almost 8 year old son and almost 5 year old daughter here yesterday. They had a great time! Before going, we decided to buy the Family Annual Passes online for $60 each rather than pay $22 each for just single day entry. We also got a discount at the cafe with the membership. At the Cafe they have coffee and a very small selection of sandwiches and salads that weren't bad, but expensive. 


The kids had a great time! It was very crowded, but considering that we went the 2nd weekend it was opened I don't think it was that bad. We only went on 1 of the rides because the lines for both rides were long. With the ride that we went on, I noticed that there were enough employees at the ride to go on with your child if they are not tall enough to ride alone and you don't have enough adults in your party to accompany all the kids. I thought that was a great way to handle the situation! 

The reason I gave 4 stars instead of 5 is because I could see this being less interesting for older kids and they could have more food variety.

Can't tell you how long I have waited to have a Hani and a coney in AZ. Well folks the time is now. Great atmosphere, good people and food that reminds me of home. Do yourself a favor and visit Detroit Coney grill. You won't be disappointed!

Was in town on Friday 3/20 for the weekend to see an A's game and stumbled upon this great place!

I got the falafel salad and sis got the flatbread pizza with kalamata, tomato, etc.. She said her pizza was PERFECT- flavors were great, cooked perfectly. My salad was good. The falafel was a tad overcooked and came out crumbly and dry...

BUT- the greens were fresh as were all the veggies in the salad! The tahini dressing was great- got a bit extra on the side. The salad also came with 2 large, warm pita breads, so I made little sandwiches with all my greens and falafel. The falafel had a goood flavor, but it was a bit hard to cut in half as it just broke apart.

The jalapeno cilantro humms was WOW- could have used a bit more jalapeno, but we totally understand that they have to please a wide range of people...

Our server was adorable. Kinda tall guy, blondish hair, very sweet- made suggestions, helped.. water filled... great guy!  He was so sweet we left him a huge tip.. probably a working student- so we wanted tohelp with tuition!!!  :-D

Anyway, wish I lived closer, I'd try other things on the wonderful, diverse menu!

We've eaten here twice and I hope other people will give it a shot. When we eat here we feel as if we've been invited over to someone's house for dinner. The proprietor goes out of her way to make sure everyone is being looked after and that the food is up to standard. The curries are wonderful and so is the jerk chicken, the goat, all fish and shrimp, the side dishes (including rice, eggplant, roti, plantains). 

The food is definitely cooked while you wait, so it takes time, but is definitely worth the wait. The only thing that needs improvement is the tables and chairs. It's a bit like patio furniture in is mismatched. I'm sure this will change with time.

I've often laughed at the fact that people write reviews for fast food chains, but two big fat middle fingers to the Jimmy John's franchise that permanently soiled my opinion of all other Jimmy John's franchises. I already found the chain shady at best due to its founder's love of big game hunting, but tonight I found myself in a pinch and decided that I could temporarily put my principle's aside to feed the family "freaky fast." After ordering $30 worth of food I asked for two cups of water. I was told I would have to PAY for them. Seriously, shame on you for your greed. I've never in my life been asked to pay for dirty-ass AZ tap water. I also ordered a sandwich with no mayo because my youngest child is allergic to mayo. Her "no mayo" wrapper of course contained a sandwich that had mayo. Good thing we caught it, because the worst ting I'm going to do about it is write reviews wherever I can. Jimmy John's on Mill, COME ON!

This is now my #1 breakfast spot in AZ! So delish and my waitress, Janiel, was awesome. She made recommendations and was spot on with her description. The pork chop was juicy and not over salted. I got pepper jack cheese on my hash browns which were actually brown. I am going to frequent this place. Great food, great service, and great vibe. Staff was laughing and joking around which tells me they have fun while working there! Thanks for a great experience Matt's Big Breakfast of Tempe. Keep it up peeps. Highly recommended you visit THIS location!!!

A friend and I decided to venture off to lunch and see what this place was about. We both agreed that we were pleasantly surprised. It's fairly a simple meal with rice, veggies, and choice of meat. We both tried the combo (chicken & steak) and it was really good! They have a bowl combo with drink for only $7.99. I got the plate, which just had more protein in its serving. Can't wait to go back and give it another try!

Went here for the first time. Nice little place. Isn't fancy schmancy, but the chipotle chicken wet burrito was delicious. I got the red sauce and man was it spicy. Not like obnoxious hot, but like a slow and strong spicy. It was really good but at the end too much for me. Ha ha! I would definitely go back and try their other options. I would definitely recommend it to anyone who wants a nice quick bite to eat. The parking is scarce but was well worth the wait.
This place is officially my favorite thin crust pizza. I really enjoy their pizza and can't wait to try other things on the menu!

Absolutely love this place!  The owner himself has been cutting my hair for several years now. I finally went for a shorter cut and he did a magnificent job. Looks good it's growing out great.  I can go in for a trim any time I want. It's always clean, it's always convenient, and he and the other stylist will help me out with a tutorial whenever I am feeling challenged. I couldn't get better customer service!  Best of all...THE PRICE IS RIGHT  !!!

Yes, I am a Genius and I am so proud to be a member of the Genius Netwok. 

Joe Polish and his team are brilliant Global
Leaders!

Each time, I am invited to join in the Genius Network, I am honored to say YES! When I go, I am thrilled to connect with such inspiring people. 

Today, JP Sears rocked the room with inspiration and humor. He was so funny! 

Thank you Joe Polish for creating the Genius Network ... I love it here!

Think twice before choosing this company for your solar needs. We have had several issues with our solar that was purchased through American solar and each time our solar stops working we immediately call for a technician to come out it takes them at least three weeks or more to just look at the issue. I've heard over and over that they are understaffed hence the delays however, perhaps hiring more technicians and how about opening the schedule on SATURDAYS to better accommodate your current customers??!?!?! We wish we would have done more homework and went with a company that is truly focused on customer service. After all, this investment was a huge expense for us. Very disappointed at their lack of commitment and getting our solar up and running promptly. Just a bummer that we made such a huge mistake.

Had this place recommended to me several years ago after a band practice and knew instantly I'd be coming back all the time. I'm a big fan of pizza and theirs is incredible, they also make the best meatball sub you've ever had. 

But the best part has GOT to be the staff. They're so nice and helpful. Like... crazy helpful. A few weeks ago my brand new bike was stolen just outside the restaurant, and they were so determined that within 30 minutes they'd found security footage of the guy and it couldn't have been more than an hour after the crime that they called me and told me they'd retrieved the bike! 

Somebody call Nic Pizzolatto - the folks at Spinatos are the real True Detectives.
Great Indian food, right level of spice and lots of flavour and great service, we felt very welcome here, thank you

Bryce,and Caleb and most of the guys at BUTTOUT  have been ABSOLUTELY AWWWSOME;they seem to care about their clients ,I have been asked to visit other providers but I can't bring myself to go..Even after the store by my house closed; I still go every 2 weeks to the Virginia store  they warranty the merchandise ,batteries mainly ,I haven't had any other problems with the equipment. And with the battery it most likely was user error. I will continue to be a loyal BUTTOUT customer. And recommend to my friends ,THEY are all great people, With great product..I think with products like theirs and the 5 star customer care and support..You don't really feel as though your at a store to buy merchandise, but rather stopping in to see friends.

I visited the store twice before I pulled the trigger on a gorgeous sofa, chair, and ottoman. I ordered it in ivory because the salesman said he'd had the very same set for years and that it was still in perfect shape. He said it was not only dirt resistant, but very durable. Also, I sprung for the warranty after he said that if any marks showed up on the upholstery, they would take care of it. 

When the furniture arrived, all was great except the ottoman is a completely different fabric quality. What's supposed to be a sturdy linen/tweed fabric was more like a thin cotton. It had/has zero durability. When it arrived it already looked old and worn out.

I called right away. They sent out a gentleman three weeks later who said, yep, looks pretty bad. In fact, by the time he got there three weeks later, the sofa and chair were already starting to look worn out too. Not just dirt - the cushions are lumpy and the fabric was already pilling and wearing after just three weeks.

Again, the gentleman said it didn't look right to him and that he would speak to the owner. Nothing ever happened. I called three times. Nothing. I finally went into the store in person and spoke with the original salesman, who was nice and said he would speak to someone and have them call me the next day. No call. I called a few days later and he said whoops, someone will call you tomorrow. Never happened.

Finally the owner took my call and was frankly rude.

He sent the same gentleman back out to look at my furniture who again said, yep this looks terrible. The quality on this furniture is horrendous. I'm a shoes-off, very clean household, and mop every day and have had white furniture before without a problem.

This isn't just color and a bit of dirt, this is fabric quality. The gentleman said he'd speak with the owner and get back to me straight away.

We settled on me asking for professional cleaning, I'd arrange to have the furniture scotch-guarded (it wasn't, despite Dante telling me this thing is dirt resistant and durable), and I requested a replacement ottoman. He apologized and said he'd ask someone to get back to me right away.

It's been TEN days. Nothing. Never, ever, ever will I shop here again. This is not just terrible furniture quality (I'm actually embarrassed by my furniture now that's only 5 months old) this customer service is terrible. The ottoman is ready for Goodwill, though I doubt anyone would want it.

I should also mention that when I told the technician that the salesman said it was dirt resistant and of sturdy quality to last ten years, the tech said, "Well he's trying to sell you something. What did you expect him to say."

Tried this cute little place while on Mill Ave with my boyfriend. Pretty good food, and the people are wonderful! Very personable. Didn't get to try the dessert, but the fresh pineapple juice is delicious!

I needed to sell my bridal set and had been to a few places.  I saw the reviews for Elite and decided to give them a try.  Wayne was very nice and made me feel comfortable and like he truly cared about my desire to part with such an emotional piece of jewelry.  He and the owner really took the time to thoroughly check over my diamond and gave me a fair price.  
I would recommend them to anyone looking to get cash for quality jewelry.

great i wish the i had a microwave :( other than that this place is alright. the gym could use a squat rack and the that's about it.

the pool is great and i dunno what else to say, it's walking distance to campus but i wish the security guards would let me smoke on the roof lmao!!

My AC would start out blowing cold air, but it would turn hot after a few minutes. I took it to a mechanic who said my compressor was bad and wanted to replace it for $1000+. I couldn't afford it. Later, I went to Hon-Man because my check engine light was on, and I happened to be in the area. They fixed my engine issue, and the AC issue (the clutch needed to be shimmed to reduce a large gap) for $80 bucks. AC works great now.

I posted a review about a year ago, attempted to continue a business relationship with AZP, but we ended up with a pretty disappointing ending...one that resulted in 2 sets of unhappy tenants moving out after poor communication & customer service from AZP.  I suspect both will be posting reviews here soon.  I've cut my losses & listed both houses for sale after struggling to make repairs...the move out inspections conducted by AZP did not assist me in preparing either home for listing!  When I told Kirsten I had another realtor to list the homes, things got icy....and I guess we broke up; she dumped me!
   After several attempts to get a good status on both homes, I was shuffled off to a customer service person to "handle" me so Kirsten & company could avoid me.  Avoid me she did; I no longer got responses to phone calls, texts, emails, or portal requests for info.  At one point, I was passed off to a man at AZ Home Renovations, a contractor hired by AZP.  He was the "fixer", the guy whose job it was to answer work orders & get repair people out to take care of issues so AZP could wash their hands of me.  As much as I enjoyed his personality, his subcontractors were sub-par, & most repairs had to be re-accomplished 2 or even 3 times...we just received another call tonight from our realtor that 2 repairs that we've already paid for were never accomplished.  I'm exhausted.  If I could recoup the time & energy devoted to follow up & blocking their blame-shifting & excuse making, I'd take a vacation.  Of course I'm out thousands...so the vacation funds are lacking.  
House #1: Tenants gave notice that they would NOT renew lease, then AZP failed to collect rent for the last month until I spurred them 3x to do so.  House was vacated, inspection was conducted by AZP & I received little to no info about the results, and had to repeatedly ask them for an assessment of damages & their professional judgement of what damages the tenants would be responsible for from their deposit.  Professional judgment has been lacking here, so I should have just hired someone to inspect on my behalf, but I DID pay a management fee for that month, so this service was paid for.  Eventually I hired someone to go inspect, and they took pictures & made a list of obvious damages that had been overlooked by the "professionals".  Examples: several windows were unable to be locked due to frame damage/house shifting (house could not be secured), broken window, front door handle was broken, broken blinds, grass in back yard was destroyed from a storage shed placed in center of yard, water damage under dishwasher, carpets were not cleaned & had stains (these were BRAND new), bath tub was not cleaned, all smoke detectors were inop, gate to backyard pool area was no longer self closing (code requirement), &  a few other minor write-ups.  
House #2: After not getting an answer from AZP about the tenant's intent to renew, I got their contact info & called the tenants directly.  The were so upset & frustrated with AZP; they decided they could not salvage the relationship & stay in the house, and they expressed that had I fired them a year ago, they would have been much happier & would have stayed.  They said Kim was so cold & rude, that it gave them anxiety to address work orders even when they needed to follow up on repairs.  They had been paying to fix minor problems on their own purely to avoid the conflict & stress of AZP employees.
Some of the issues: the landscaper AZP hired had taken the winter off but still billed & was paid (from my rent $) by AZP, so we had LOTS of catch up work to do to get things under control.  I asked to be reimbursed the months of fees I had paid when no service was provided; they ignored this request with a "let's see what we can do to make it right", then silence.  I emailed 3x to give "last call" to resolve, then I gave up.  The move out inspection for this house was better, but the very nice tenants had taken good care of the place, & they actually told me about a few discrepancies they found themselves after the inspection (ovens needed to be cleaned, spots on driveway), & they offered to clean the carpets after I called them in desperation to understand the inspection results.  It took a week & 3 requests to get the inspection results, but then they refused to give me an assessment and merely referred me to some postage-stamp-sized black & white photos that were contained in the report.  The tenant told me the inspector stated the carpets "had to go"; but they did not tell me whether it was due to damage or normal wear & tear.  Eventually the tenant just offered to have them cleaned, so I stopped asking for the "professional opinion" I knew I would never get from AZP.  Again I sent my own inspector to make an assessment, again they found obvious problems that should have been identified, but I just worked w/the tenants since AZP was obviously done making money from me, so they are done talking to me.  It's over!!
Love coming here, this place is amazing, this guy fixes me right up (Arron) takes care of me .. Thank you  .. I feel much better... See you in a couple weeks.

I came in feeling pretty down, but when I Got my hair done and a Massage by my favorite therapist ...just WOW thank you Arron. I feel much better no more headaches and body aches and I can get through my day.
thank you

you would never know it by looking at it but this is a diamond in the rough . in an old run down strip mall that seriously needs to new life breathed into it. this place doesnt look like much from the outside. but once you go in it's an all different world. 
ive tried a few other barber shops around town but they always just felt so sketchy and ghetto. this place is clean it has nice chairs. it has a well kept appearance and staff is not angry or aggressive but instead laid back and joke around. 
they even have a n64 to play while you wait lol. 
I went on a monday which is when they do walk ins only, from the sound of other peoples reviews is sounds like they didnt even bother checking out this places site or google it. cus mondays they dont allow appointment's but all other days they do and any place with respectable and good barbers will be booked solid, if they are not booked then they prob arnt good enough to bring back repeat clientele. 
.  
my barber was justin and all I came in for was a shave and to line up my beard , which had i gone to most places they would just try to get me in and out . instead he took time to chat with me and make sure he knew exactly what I wanted . and he gave me an awesome straight razor shave. they go all out and do the whole process correct including lotion before the shave and hot and cold towel treatments. (maybe my only complaint was the hot towel could have been hotter but thats a personal preference) justin really did an awesome job though , he told me all what he did and he took extra time and care when lining up my beard which is awesome to see and he had a good enough touch not to irritate my skin since I have acne scars. I am for sure gonna come back to him and get my hair cut here next time I need it. i cant vouch for any other barber at this place but if you want a clean environment with friendly staff and at least one for sure skilled barber check it out and ask for justin.

If you like crispy wings this is the spot for you. 

Now I'm not a crispy wing guy . and this place is def more on the crispy side. That being said I will still be back here again. They have really good sauce. I tried the reg med sauce and a honey hot both very good. They got a good thick ranch. And maybe the coolest thing about this place next to their soda machine is a koolaid dispenser. Side note if you are an adult who has not had koolaid in like 10 years take it easy drinking two large cups will make you feel like crap later. Lol but I just thought that was really cool. Service was good not slow at all but just slow enough so you know they are making the wings to order. And not just giving you wings that have been sitting out. 
Also I checked out their larger order prices and the or ice for 24 wings or more was pretty damn good so this is a good place to go if your getting wings for a party.

I will admit right off the bat mellow has some good deals and great beer selection which is why I have given them any stars. their late night happy hour is the best deal on mill ave on a week day night right up there with cue clubs drink prices. 
however that is where the good things stop for this location, this is some of the worst service I have ever received. I have been here on 2 different occasions and both times left a bad taste in my mouth here is just a short list of things that were not satisfying about it ,

going up to the bar and waiting for service for 5 min when the bar only had 3 other people at it. then waiting another 5 min for my beer
having then try and charge me for beers i did not order or drink
having them bring more then one person in party (3 to be exact) the wrong beers 
food taking upwards of 25 min for apps
bartenders giving 0 attention even when I am asking about specific beers on tap they do not know descriptions to give me 

no one in the place made me feel welcome , made me feel they knew anything about their own jobs or products, or even cared to try. its unfortunate  cus it is such a great location and I have been to other locations and never had any of these issues. even the manager who came to speak with us about our beers being incorrect and our tab being wrong was rude and seemed like he didnt care , will not be going back to this location.
cant go wrong ! plus 3 dollar car bombs
My least favorite ramen place. I'm just spoiled by really good ramen in my home town of Portland.

Absolutely beware of the parking. I paid huge dollars for Wicked tickets months ago.  The performance is next week. I received an email TODAY that no ASU parking is available as school is in session. The closest parking is on 5th and Maple.  This should be disclosed at time of ticket purchase so an informed decision can be made.

Nice lil beer bar.  I found out about this place from thepokerpub.com.  The people here are friendly and I felt very welcome on my first visit.  Liked it so much I went back the next morning since I saw a Husker banner on the wall.  There were about 15 rooting Husker fans in the place the next day and I had a good time.  I'll be back next Saturday for sure.  Go Big Red!!!

Rich dida complete refret plus nut and saddle on my classical guitar.
I don't think you can find anyone better at what he does.  He has  a
lifetime of experience and accumulated knowledge, which makes him
a rare bird.  Making a guitar sing the way its supposed to is as much
an art as building the guitar in the first place.  Having someone around
that understands all the technical aspects and nuance of how it all
works together....priceless!!

Thanks, Rich!!
Cheeto and Rocky enjoyed their stay at the pet hotel for a few weeks! I would recommend them to anyone!
Worst service, worst food ever, I'm a culinary school graduate and I would not recommend this place to anyone.

I have been to this Landis a few times over the last 10 years or so and it's a pretty good place to get some help and they have a good selection of brands to choose from.  

Staff was help full helping me pick out my new bike, but I kind of already knew what I wanted from what I saw on the Internet.

I ordered my bike, they said should be on Wed. so I called on Thurs. morning and they said "yeah we got it but we need to put it together, call you when it's done."    ---FYI it takes about 15 minute to put a bike together.

So I went on Fri. morning (they didn't call) and they had it almost done and took about 10 min to finish.     

Kinda made me mad they were so blase about it.

My couch cushions were getting flat so what's a guy like me to do?  Stuff them myself with old newspapers? Yeah right, but I did think of that.

They knew exactly what the problem was and the proper way to stuff them.  They are actually better than new.  They charged $65 per cushion, but I thought it was a fair price since it's way cheaper than a new couch.

It looks like the service I used them for is just the tip of the iceberg.  They repair, restore, and recover about anything.

Casey Moore oh how I love thee.   You helped me through college even more than all my classes and prof's combined.   

You taught me that day drinking was an acceptable practice.   

You taught me on many a nights that drinking and biking don't mix.

You even clean up nice enough that I brought my family and grandma here for dinner once.   

Happy hours with co-workers you're into that too.  First date, yup, you're on it.

Thanks Casey!

This place blows.  Staff doesn't have a clue about customer service, (except a cute waitress but she was working on the patio).  Food was blah.  Spring rolls with out Thai basil, seriously? Pho was alright, but the sides of sprouts and basil were almost spoiled.

Horrible, no. Below average, yes.

So my electric back hair shaver (aka MANGROOMER Do-It-Yourself Electric Back Hair Shaver)  was on the fritz and boy was my back getting a little to "Robin William's" like and I couldn't stand it any longer.  I had to get it fixed!

This place can repair any type of shaving device, add new blades, or they even sell you a new one if needed.

They also sell and repair small appliances, vacuum cleaners, coffee pots, and blenders.

---Really I just come here to get the blade and foil replaced on my razor. 

The location on Northern, and the one on Central are both closed now.

Ted's is a classic Tempe landmark. I grew up ni Tempe and this place always brings back great memories. The food is all made from scratch fresh each day. The staff is always friendly. Try the italian sausage and potato salad. Ted's never disappoints.

Get there by 11 for an early lunch or after 1pm to avoid the massive lines.

Came here because of the review and the movie theater next door. Didn't go wrong! They made the spicy food I was craving for after a marathon 12 hours working without proper lunch! Drunken noodles was best with Napa cabbage and finely made tofu

Tried Mysore Masala Dosa, Paneer Dosa and Rava Masala Dosa. Taste doesn't come close to home, but $5, I cant complain. As many noted more of Andhra taste. OK to try if you are craving to eat Dosas. Mysore Masala was best comparatively, paneer coming second.

The place used to be good, but not any more. They have settled for mediocre taste & customer service like any other Indian restaurant in the valley. Don't expect a miracle, but if you are hungry and want to grab some spice after a Sun Devils game, then not a bad choice. Better than other Indian shops in that area.

I have taken two people here over the last few years, one to get their _____'s pierced and and the other one got her ____ pierced, (twice actually they had to re-do it over because it migrated).

Very professional, and very helpful answering questions and walk you through the process of putting a needle through your skin without anesthesia.

Yes the staff may be full of holes, stretched out, and tattooed from head to toe they still do a wonderful job so don't be scared.

Who knows maybe someday I'll get a piercing for myself.

This is my favorite Indian restaurant in the valley.   There are always different and interesting choices on the buffet.  Try the sauces,  there's a coconut one, and the cucumber/yogurt one is the tastiest I've ever had.

I've been here 10-15 times and always really enjoyed the food here.   

Atmosphere, yeah right, there is none just good food. 

They open at 11:30 and I really wish they would open at least 30 min earlier.  I've sat in the parking lot drooling on myself waiting for them to open on several occasions.

I wanted to hate this place more than I do, but it's not that bad.   Been here a few times and the food was average to above average.  Drinks were normal, but any specialty drinks or tequilas seemed expensive. The nachos were very good, and different than most places.  I liked the music, and no they don't play much Santana at all.

The staff is young and inexperienced, so service is hit or miss. 

 If I had to hang out at Tempe Marketplace I'd come back here I guess.

Best Japanese curry this side of Kyoto.  Other items are pretty good too but you gotta get away from the same old teriyaki people.  Food has always been hot and fresh.  Service has been great too.  I've been coming here for about 10 years and always really enjoyed this place.

Nice.  So I tried my first pasty today, and damn is was good.  I had the Shepard's Pie which was filled with meat, peas, carrots, and potatoes all covered in cheese and then stuffed in a flaky crust. They have many different kinds (about 25) so I guess I need to go back 24 more times or so.

They also have really a really good beer selection but I would rather drink all day at a place like Casey's Moore's and then stumble down here for the food.

Minus one star for not being around when I went to ASU and lived just down the street from this place, I could have biked home from the bars with a pasty in my hand.

Ah yes, American sushi.    White, frat boy sushi chefs.   The server was under 21 so her friend had to drop off the drinks as she followed here to the table.

It's an alright place, not bad for ASU but that's where the buck stops. The asparagus app. was good. The rolls were good.  We didn't get sick, good.


Smoking hot Asian hostess..... arrrrrrrr...............

Wow, better than I expected.  Don't let the tacky fluorescent writing all over the front windows deter you, or the fact that it's in an aging strip mall.

Modestly decorated inside. Quick attentive staff.  I only had the green curry and it was a big portion and just spicy enough.  Lunches come with either soup or salad, which is just iceberg a few carrots and a drizzle of dressing. Simple but good.  Also included is a small egg roll which was darn good.

I had a yummy Thai coffee which was $1.95 and came in a really big glass. 

I give this place five stars because they don't suck. I've been to the Subway next door about a thousand times and most of the time they do suck. No more Subway for me.

I guess they were okay for a CHAIN, in a MALL.  Service was quick and even gave us free endame, I know, that's not much but it's something.  Just had a few rolls all of which were fine.  3 of the 4 rolls were about the size as a coffee cup, way too big for a humans mouth.  So what's a person do with rolls that are too big?

Do you: 

A) Push the entire roll in you pie-hole and hope no food falls out when you start chewing.
B) Cut up the roll with a knife and fork.
C) Use your chopsticks to pick apart the roll into small bite size portions.

Have your answer ready before you visit this place.

Dou you ever try to go back to a restaurant and order something you loved the last time just to be disappointed. The last time I had the Sam Adams pot and the flavors were full and unique. this time someone forgot the beer or something, Very disappointed it is not consistent. Server Matthew could be more attentive, he disappeared for long periods.  Could be better, had better.

Total waste of time. If I could rate this dealer it would be zero stars! I Worked with sales rep Kevin. I Was lied to several times . Was misled that the vehicle I was purchasing was a 6 cylinder when it was a 4. Very disorganized and incompetent couldn't answer any questions I had. Lack of confidence and going to his sales manager every five minutes because I was persistent on getting my questions answered. Was lied to and was told by Kevin that the second key to the vehicle would be made the following day. The next day came in I was ready to put my down payment on the vehicle and I had instantly got so disgruntled when I was told Kevin knew nothing about the key remake AND the order was never put into place; AND that it will be another few days if I wanted the second key. Completely unexceptable. I spoke with the sales manager Don which he was ok to deal with and tried to make the deal work and make me happy. But I declined all negotiations because the excuse I got from the sales manager was that Kevin was new.. So what if he is new he was a clutz! Pick who you hire because IM sure I'm not the only customer they lost. Seriously this guy had little to no experience in Car sales. How do I know this? When driving off the lot he gave me the wrong key to the car when I was driving off. Total klutz! I was also told that the vehicle would come with a full tank of gas, and only came with a half a tank. If they were honest with me I would have felt better to know what to expect. I am Just completely disgusted and would never refer anyone to this dealer. Bought the same vehicle at billluke across the street with 15k mi less and a year newer for the same price and even received a $1000 cash offer in addition. Coulter did not value my business enough to make it right. Returning the vehicle was the best thing I did. Glad I did my homework. Go BILL LUKE!

Completely insulted by the dr. Wish I remembered her name. I brought my daughter in. My daughter didn't feel comfortable being touched and cringed trying to pull away. The dr had the nerve to ask if she was autistic. Will never come here again or recommend this place to anyone!
Fast appointment. Friendly staff. Reasonable  prices and was easily approved for care credit due to an unexpected expense. Will come back for all my pets needs.

Me and my whole family had went here only because it's close to our home and they took our Insurence. We all had our eye exams my hubby and daughter found glasses they liked as I was skeptical because the quality I opted to go elsewhere. My daughter got her glasses first which the screws fell out two days later after receiving them, they fixed them we moved on.. My hubby's glasses however took very long because they "broke" in the lab. No phone call to let us know until we came back two and a half weeks later they were still not in. We gave them til the end of the week which they promised they will be in by.. They were not even shipped out yet. We straight up said ok give us the refund and we will go elsewhere. Ofcourse they couldn't refund it because the manager wasn't there. So we waited three more days to get them. Meanwhile I just had my script with a different company and the script was completely wrong! I cant see anything upclose. So I had to make another appointment with these incompetent dweebs. I had a different doctor this time and I pray he knows what he is doing.  So I have to wait another 10 days to get them fixed. I took my daughter for her wellness exam after her glasses came in with her pediatrician and they seriously asked me when was the last time she had her eyes checked. So again I need to have my daughters eyes re evaluated. My husband gets his glasses and he swears he sees worse in them then his old glasses. My husband went back after a few hours after getting his glasses and just straight up told them he wants a refund on his glasses and that he will never come back because they managed to screw up all three of our prescriptions. They had the nerve to give him a hard time and refused to refund the eye exam. We will be disputing this with our insurance company and credit card company!  Never again will I ever trust or recommend anyone to this place! They seem like a high turn over in doctors. I've seen a total of three different doctors working there.

I have had a great experience through this Dr office for 17 years since my son was born. The staff treats you like family including follow up wellness calls after my son being sick. Granted we didn't have anything critical to deal with but the service all these years was appreciated.

I love this Trader Joes. The store is always clean and inviting. It's small so not overwhelming like a large grocery store. Not only are the employees super helpful they are really nice like they are just happy to be there and help. Interestingly the customers are all really nice too. Flowers and wine are all crazy inexpensive.  If I'm in a down mood a pop in to TJ's is even a spirit lifter. 

My favorite item is dark chocolate covered almonds with sea salt. 

Oh and I also recommend  the lavender sea salt scrub and lavender lotion. Really nice skin care products that smell amazing and priced so reasonable! 

I   trader Joes!

Great taco shop!  I love the al pastor "anything!"  This is the only taco joint I've found real al pastor in the valley.  The only other time I've had al pastor is in Playa del Carmen, MX.  Thanks for bring one of my favorite dishes to the the valley.

Deathly delicious!!!!!!!!  The pizza sauce is super tasty, the thin crust is really good, the ingredients are fresh, the salad dressing is top notch and the service was fast and friendly!  Definitely going back!

I'd give this place 1 star but for the fact that the service was good. Perhaps the food is good too, but I will NEVER buy loose-leaf tea here again. It's not loose-leaf... it's POWDERED. Unless you happen to like to drink gritty tea and be left with a goopy mess at the bottom of your  cup, I'd suggest taking your business elsewhere.

Susan helped us sell our home.  She is a very good communicator and stays on top of all the tasks that are required.  We never worried about any part of the process because she had everything under control.  She is very pro-active and worked the listing and did not just sit on it.  She and her husband are a very good team.  He held several open houses for us.  Susan is very hard working and does a great job of making sure the house is priced right which is the key to actually selling the home.

Extremely pleased with the attention to detail and Aaron's drive to make the truck look like new.  The paint color was difficult to match but they stuck with it until they got it right.  I highly recommend Campus.

I was given a Groupon for Micheles as a gift for a massage and Mini Facial. I loved it. I did do an add on for the Dermaplaning and it too was wonderful as well as purchased an exfoliator scrub. The staff was very nice and professional. The place was very clean and relaxing. My only reason for 4 stars is the scheduling. I tried to make the appointment online but couldnt figure out how to add the Groupon # so I wasn't charged for the appointment. I tried calling by phone but had a hard time reaching someone. When I did get someone I scheduled about a month out but never got a reminder call until the morning of my appointment. I would suggest having reminder calls the day prior and maybe being open more days a week. Other then that I would highly recommend this place. Its too bad its so far away from me.

I have been using Guacbox food service for the past 4 weeks and the food is delicious! I have lost about 8 pounds but could have lost more if I didnt cheat or drink alcohol on the weekends lol... She delivers on time and as promised for a fair delivery charge and the food price is good! I am going to attempt to try to Prep my meals for a bit and if all else fails I will be running back ro Guacbox for sure! Thanks for being Awsome
This place is awesome! The portion sizes are massive so you will always have some left over for later! I hope they bring a location to the west valley ASAP because I could eat this on the regular.

Cool place to stay, very centrally located with an awesome shopping complex right next door. Free and easy parking. However, if you get a place for its kitchen (which I did) then DON'T book here. No pots or pans, strainers, kitchen knives. Literally nothing to cook with other than a faulty stove top that is useless with out kitchen supplies. Certainly won't be using is as an extended stay ever again but it's not a bad hotel.

Just another rave review for Oscar and Dealer's Choice, this place is amazing! Like so many other reviewers Oscar treated my car like it was his own, he and his expert staff did an incredible job on my vehicle and went way beyond what they needed to do. 
I had my car painted and the finish is impeccable, like it just rolled out of the showroom, BUT that's not all Oscar did for me, he and his crew fixed and touched up a dozen items that weren't required in the scope of the job. They just really want the work to exceed your expectations, think about that for a moment .... these days who does more than they need to?
Dealer's Choice does, don't hesitate for an instant, call them or stop by, your car will love you.
I wouldn't go anywhere else!

Five stars for good reason, IDoctor AZ does great work for a fair price. What more could you want than good work for a fair price? How about honest communication and genuine concern about the health of your electronics? Yep, Vahe does that too, I had my iphone6 screen and digitizer replaced today in less than 30 minutes, phone looks and works perfectly, fingerprint reader and all. BUT ... I also had a broken iphone4 with me and Vahe basically asked me if he could PLEASE have a look at it for no charge, I let him and he ended up fixing it for free. I highly recommend IDoctor AZ and Vahe for repair of your iphone, he and his service are amazing!!!! I will certainly return and will recommend him to friends and family. Don't hesitate, go there, you won't be sorry :)

I used to come here more often but not so much anymore since they changed their menu about a year ago (with most of it still being the same) and with the service quality seeming to go down quite a bit. The food overall is pretty decent, about a 3.5/5 for me, but the service is always so hit or miss... it's either good and attentive, or quite lacking and sass-filled. It's mostly because of the impertinent waitresses that I get half the time that I don't really come here very often anymore; the food is mostly good and decently priced, but I usually feel more comfortable going other places. On a positive note they do have pretty clean bathrooms though, lol.
Beautiful patio- feels like you are dining on a patio in Europe!! The food was amazing, ambiance was romantic! Definitely would go back for a dinner date or drinks/appetizers on the patio!

Ordered delivery.... Gyro and chicken pita hardly had any tomatoes- "ok" for "fast food" gyros. We also ordered the Greek fries and they delivered plain fries with ketchup. They offered to bring us out the Greek fries which was nice, but they were nothing but gross, cold fries with a little feta and parm. Would have been happier with mcdonalds fries.

After seeing their facebook page and seeing that they knew all the latest styles it seemed like a good place to get a haircut so I decided to give it a try. Went with a picture and had also requested someone that knew how to use a straight edge razor. I was assured that would be no problem. I arrived for my haircut, the guy was surprised that I requested a razor cut and had to borrow a razor from another stylist.  My haircut looked nothing like the picture I brought and turned out to be one of the worst haircuts I ever received. I will not be returning.
What a great find! So many unique clothes and accessories! Tonia was so helpful and made the shopping experience fun! Will be back soon for more fun costume/festival attire!!

I have just recently moved out of Apache Station; this move has come two years too late. 
When I first moved in, I was a sophomore in college and I enjoyed the laid-back atmosphere Apache provided. I was a frequent attender of the social gatherings and parties held by the complex at the front pool.
As a junior, a year later, I was also relieved to see that the parties had dwindled, as now I was focused on my budding career. The social atmosphere was never a problem.
In my junior year, I transfered from a two bedroom to a single, and this is where the trouble seemed to escalate. I had maintenance on speed dial- my fridge was constantly breaking, my water pipes were clogged, and a horrid smell was emitting from the combination of a broken fridge and a soiled drainage pipe. This problem, despite maintenance's frequent visits and "fixed" persisted for two years. I stuck it out, though, because I knew I would be moving shortly after graduation. 
One month ago, I returned my keys and felt a sense of relief as I moved into a new apartment in Gilbert that does not leak air, does not smell moldy, and has working light fixtures. 
My relief was short lived.
A few day ago, I was notified that my bank account was negative $500. I quickly checked the balance and transactions, and noticed that although I cancelled recurring payments of Apache's auto-pay, my $700 rent still went out. I will admit here that I am at fault; I should have checked to see if it truly did cancel, but I thought a quick call to my old residency would fix this problem.
I was informed, rudely, by the front office staff that there was no way to reverse this charge. The staff informed me as well that the manager would not be available to speak to until Monday, but "We can return your check along with your security deposit within 30-60 business days."
This lead me to a different question: Where indeed was my security deposit? I left my single spotless. There may have been some "living" wear and tear (possible spots left on the carpet, hard water in the shower), but what I was told was the "damage" was unheard of.

I was charged a fee of $150 for a deposit two years ago. I now find myself owing Apache $100. Why, you ask?  

Toilet cleaning fee: $25
Counter-top cleaning: $55.00
New carpet (which Apache does anyway before leasing another room): $100
Wall repair: $75

and a few outstanding odds and ends including "drawer fixing" (one screw was loose- I asked which drawer), which was a fee of $30.

I requested an itemized list of said charges, only to be told that it had been sent and my address confirmed. I still have not received this list.

I was then informed that, although 10 minutes prior to this discussion on my missing deposit it was stated that my $700 would indeed be returned, it seems now that they have no record of a $700 check.

Here is how rent works at Apache:
You may choose to write a personal check, or you may use their automated system. I set my bank account up to deliver a personal check of $700 every 31st of the month in order for it to arrive at Apache by the 5th of the following month, which is when all rent is due. They usually cash all rent checks on the 9th- something I was aware of.

My $700 rent went out on the 31st of July, again, my mistake, and was just cashed yesterday. In order for me to be out $700, Apache MUST have cashed this check; they insist they have not cashed it and the money is still in my account.

I was asked to provide a bank statement proving they cashed it, but I had to report in person to the complex by Monday before 4:00pm. I work full time in Queen Creek: there is no possible way this can happen. I was told with a brief 'sorry' that that was all that could be done.

I am working with my bank to reverse the charges, but in the meantime, I advise any potential tenants to please be very careful when applying. Hidden fees and charges will sneak up on you and your lease will never end.

I finally get a chance to sit down and write my review been a busy season but I feel I must! I used frequent this UPS location but I won't any longer I walked in at 8:15 in the morning and the woman working the counter is on her cell phone. I stood there packages in hand nut I might as well have been a wallflower! I stood there for approximately three minutes  it sounded to me like she was conducting personal business so not wanting to interrupt I waited. After that even a family emergency would have been un- excusable. Never even acknowledged my presence. I finally left in search of professional employees that serve the customers and take care of their personal affairs on their own time. Thanks  annoyed customer
LOVE THIS BOOKSTORE! Great events, great people, great books... It has my heart.
Great service! Krysha was very helpful and friendly! Will definitely be back. If you need flooring, this is the spot!

First time at this location and wasn't impressed with service initially. We had 6-people in our party and we're celebrating an event. Our greeting was fair, but impersonal. Our initial seating and server left us wanting to leave. After I presented my experience to the manager (Kylie), he promptly corrected our issues and provided us with a great server (Alex) who made our night. The food was excellent and we all had a great time. Thank you Kylie and Alex for a great evening.!
I ordered a small latte and a frittata both were good.  Nice atmosphere and music.  But when i asked for the wifi password they said there is no wifi which was a bit disappointing.

Great atmosphere busy indeed specially on the Friday noonish that i visited.  Very friendly staff by far the friendliest i have seen.  Ordered a drip coffee with the yelp check-in coupon and a carrot cake.  Both were fantastic.
Nice friendly staff, Arian helped me at this location he took his time to explain all the options and plans at my disposal.
Nice friendly staff, Arian helped me at this location he took his time to explain all the options and plans at my disposal.
Great barbershop with great service, got my haircut by Micheal and he did an awesome job cutting it the way I wanted. Highly recommend

Just yumm...period.
Every1 in family always happy with order. Burgers, chicken, sides...its all good.

Had lunch at Freezers yesterday. I highly recommend the philly  sandwich. It was amazing. I have never had such a good philly as the one yestersay. We also had for sinner their ceasar chicken wrap. Absolutely amazing as well. I will for sure be back. Swrvice waa amazing as well as very kind servers.

I have been an avid weightlifter and exercise enthusiast for many years, always creating my own routines and working out alone.  About 2 years ago, feeling like my workouts were getting a little stale, I decided to attend one of Jakub's "boot camp" training sessions.  I quickly realized, even with regular trips to the gym, that my fitness level wasn't as good as it should be.  My cardio and stamina have improved drastically since beginning my training sessions with Jakub.  Jakub's boot camp sessions are always unique, with brand new exercises introduced every time.  It's obvious that he keeps up on all the latest exercise science, and he prepares extensively for each training session.  Prior to the start of each session, he has all of the stations (both indoors and outdoors) set up and ready to go, complete with all of the props (truck tires, weighted sleds, jump ropes, cones, sledgehammers, or even a car in neutral ready to be pushed!)  He is great at demonstrating the exercises, getting everyone warmed up and stretched out, and providing the necessary motivation during the workouts.  Jakub has an easy going manner, he is never berating, and he constantly provides positive feedback and encouragement during training.

Great food & great service when ordering as always :-)

Now ask to use the restroom after 12midnight & their A+ customer service does a 180 & goes to down right rude.  I was honestly surprised at how disrespectful their staff was when I asked why their restrooms were closed & when I inquired more about the policy 3 staff members were so down right rude I simply walked out.

This location needs a serious attitude adjustment, which is too bad cause the food itself is great!

Bill and his team helped my 89 year old father sell his home when he moved out of state. He went above and beyond the call of duty in an impressive respectful and professional manner. If you have a home to sell or buy, call The Bill Omstead team, You'll definitely be impressed and obtain great results.

This is the way car buying should be. Stopped in to see a car advertised on line.  Test drive the car sat down went over the car fax and pricing. Bought the car below book value and was in and out of the dealership in about an hour and a half. Jeff in sales and Dan in finance were excellent. We didn't need to see 3 managers and sit and wait around. Excellent car buying experience.

I've been to this location three times (all drive-thru), and have had issues during two of my visits. 
First visit: I ordered the bacon turkey bravo sandwich. Before I left, I checked the sandwich and it had turkey, lettuce, and onion....
.... the bacon turkey bravo has BACON, lettuce, tomato, turkey, and cheese. I ended up going inside and an employee (don't know his name) prepared another sandwich for me, the correct way.
Second visit: I checked my food before leaving, and all was well. 
Third visit (tonight): Like always, I ordered the bacon turkey bravo. This time the sandwich had all the correct ingredients, but, the tomatoes were cut into wedges... yeah, wedges... on a sandwich. 
I ended up calling three times and finally got through to a manager. She didn't say much, not sure if she truly cared, so here I am. 
No clue why I've only had problems with this location, but it definitely seems like they need to train their employees again, because they don't know what they're doing when it comes to preparing menu items. 
This is what my sandwich shit out:

My girlfriend and I came here for the first time the other day, and the food was awesome! I got the grilled cheese sandwich with tomato soup, and a cinnamon pancake (random, I know), and she got the OMG French toast. The only reason I'm not giving 5 stars is because there was stuff floating in my water, and there still was even after they replaced my drink. Definitely give this place a try!

So, let me just say something- this was my first time here and these sandwiches have NO MEAT. I ended up adding my own meat and cheese at home to taste something besides the bread. But, the broccoli cheddar soup was great, which was why I rated two stars. If you're wanting a fully loaded sandwich, this isn't the place to be.

THIS PLACE IS AMAZING!! I go to both locations, depending where I am in the day, and wow- both have great service, friendly staff, and the sandwiches are phenomenal. The bread is so soft and fresh, and I love how the sandwiches are actually stuffed with meat- not just two measly pieces. Two thumbs up!!

The quality of these sandwiches have gone downhill. This is the only location where they make them with very little meat, and hardly any mayo or mustard. I don't see how difficult it is to make a good sandwich. I pretty much paid $4 to taste bread. Back to Subway I go. You let me down, Sprouts.

I stopped in here a few days ago to purchase an AV cable and controller for my N64. The two men working were super nice and helpfully answered my questions I had about certain games. I'll definitely be coming back. Thanks, guys!

Tina is the new owner of this salon & it's beautiful! She does fantastic work & she really cares about high quality. Go see them soon, you'll quickly become a regular. 
Tina has been doing my nails for a year now & I refuse to go to anyone else. It can be so difficult to find someone who's concerned about taking care of people rather than the "turn & burn" attitude. But Tina is amazing. And my nails look phenomenal EVERY TIME!!
Don't be swayed by any reviews older than 2 months- those are about the previous owners. Give Tina a chance & you'll have found your new favorite nail salon.

This place had some pretty good pho tai. Its just a plain ol' restaurant with a bunch of tables and chairs. Some TVs to watch whatever happens to be on at the time. Seemed to be packed right up until the minute they closed - which we knew that minute was coming when they were putting chairs on the tables around us.

If you want to feel an amazing experience with a Dentist, then you should consider going to Dr. Jared Nesbit. He would make u feel extremely comfortable and you wont feel the pain at all.. Overall, the best Dentist I ever had.

Me and my friends went to this place today. The ambiance is simple but good... It just opened 10 days ago but has great food... The service was great... The waiters were extremely good and helpful. They are Americans but they seem to practice a lot on their vocabulary of Indian dishes. We had mainly South Indian food. Sambhaar was brilliant. The taste was like home made. Dosas were crispy and cooked to perfection. The owner also came and met us and was very social and humble. Last course was Desserts: just too awesome to be explained. I would say the best gajar Halwa, I ate in US so far. Gulab Jamuns were very soft and they just melted in mouth. Badam Halwa was like a rich royal food. I will definitely go next week to try their North Indian delicacies. An amazing and stomach stuffing experience!!

Buff N File Nail Spa is newly opened, in Tempe and it's awesome!! All the nail techs are great here! I normally just do gel mani and pedi but I have seen plenty of customers get their acrylics done and they turn out beautiful. Every color in the salon has a gel that matches. Beautiful, clean and fun atmosphere. Check them out on the corner or Southern and McClintock!!

I got an industrial piercing at another piercing spot and the girl put it in incredibly wrong. I went to HTC to ask them if there was any way I could save it and unfortunately there wasn't. They removed it for me and were so nice and helpful that I decided to go back to them to pierce my other ear. They did such an awesome job! They are so professional and helpful, I recommend them to everybody.

This place in incredible; best Indian food in town. The samosas are terrific, and the garlic naan is perfect. I usually order the chicken tikka masala, and it has never let me down. The food is a little pricey, but certainly worth it. The staff is very attentive and accommodating.

Good food is good and the service matches it. Friendly and attentive wait staff. Food was fresh and the staff seemed very open to customizing it a bit. Came here for dinner and would certainly go back. 

My only slight disappointment is their pita bread but not a big deal at all.

If you want the short of it - Nadine and Joe work hard to cater to their clients and make the environment fun... but they do not sacrifice quality of the program. I highly recommend them if you are looking to make a fitness transition in your life.

The long of it: a few years back I had back surgery. I was told by the doc to lose weight and fast. I was nearing 300 pounds at one point and finally came to terms with needing help. I came across Nadine by luck and did my due diligence (she is certified and insurred... not just a jock with a dream). After my first workout I realized that this Zandt, caring group would be where I would go.

Fast forward 15 months (I'll save the workout details for when you try it... lol). I lost 90 pounds, put on more muscle, my metabolism is in check. I'm eating healthier and living better than I was. I worked hard to get here... and while it took my own determination to get here, their help and motivation and guidance was worth it.

While it is time for me to move on to maintenance mode for my fitness... I plan to drop in now and again and take a cardio plunge with these guys.

This is really the best housecleaning service in Tempe. Angel is a nice person, she is professional! Makes our apartment super cleaning! And she helped me organize my stuff, and she did great! I will definitely recommend Eco Angel to any of my friends who need the housecleaning!

I am very pleased with FG Photography. I was VERY pregnant and Felicia was very patient with all my hotflashes and the need for breaks. She listened to my ideas of what I wanted and helped capture it. Because I was so pregnant I wanted specific editing done and she did a great job! My daughter and myself will cherish this forever. I will definately recommend FG photography to my friends!

I was in Tempe for a business related meeting. I decided to take a walk one evening and stumbled upon this great little boutique. I found gifts for my family and discovered Alex and Ani bracelets. Alex and Ani products are sustainably made in America and the company is socially and environmentally conscious. What's not to like?!?! Plus their stuff is super cute.
